apiVersion.description: ApiVersion flag to use new version of Plaid API

clientName.description: Displayed once a user has successfully linked their account

env.description:
The Plaid API environment on which to create user accounts.
For development and testing, use tartan. For production, use production

institution.description: Open link to a specific institution, for a more custom solution

publicKey.description:
The public_key associated with your account; available from
the Plaid dashboard (https://dashboard.plaid.com)

product.description:
The Plaid products you wish to use, an array containing some of connect,
auth, identity, income, transactions, assets

token.description:
Specify an existing user's public token to launch Link in update mode.
This will cause Link to open directly to the authentication step for
that user's institution.

public_token.description:
This is the token that will be returned for use in Dash. Can also be
understood as the "output" of this component

selectAccount.description:
Set to true to launch Link with the 'Select Account' pane enabled.
Allows users to select an individual account once they've authenticated

webhook.description: Specify a webhook to associate with a user.

onSuccess.description:
A function that is called when a user has successfully onboarded their
account. The function should expect two arguments, the public_key and a
metadata object

onExit.description: A function that is called when a user has specifically exited Link flow

onLoad.description:
A function that is called when the Link module has finished loading.
Calls to plaidLinkHandler.open() prior to the onLoad callback will be
delayed until the module is fully loaded.

onEvent.description: A function that is called during a user's flow in Link.

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called whenever any of the
properties change
